Description: Beautiful Slow Iced Tea Fade 2014 Benchmark R8 Les Paul from the Gibson Custom Shop. Purchased used from Wildwood. The neck profile is much closer to an R0 than a typical R8 and the top is more similar to an R9 than a typical R8 (see the stats below for the neck dimensions courtesy of Wildwood). I'm selling for the same reason I always do - making space for other purchases. In full transparency, there is a slight run of the red dye on the neck binding on the Low E side near the fifth and twelfth frets (see photo). This is pretty common in the Custom Shop Les Pauls of this timeframe and it is fading, but I want to make sure that's known. There are also minor finish blemishes on the headstock and the body (very hard to photograph) and I've only recently noticed them. See Greg Koch's review of this exact guitar / Serial number: Gibson Custom Shop Benchmark Limited Run Historic 1958 Hand Picked Les Paul Gloss • SN: 84278 - YouTube Video will open in a new window Using the eBay App? Paste link into a browser window:[isdntekvideo] Additional description from Wildwood: Serial Number: 84278Brand: Gibson Custom Shop Model: Limited Run Historic 1958 Hand Picked Les Paul Gloss Finish Color: Slow Iced Tea Fade Weight: 8.68 lbs Top Wood: Slightly Figured Carved Maple Body Wood: Solid Non-Weight Relieved Mahogany Neck Wood: 1-Piece Mahogany Neck Neck Shape: Early '50s Rounded Neck Dimensions: .880 1st - .950 12th Fingerboard: 1-Piece Rosewood Fingerboard Radius: 12" Inlays: Cellulose Trapezoids Frets: 22 Scale Length: 24.75" Width at Nut: 1 11/16" Frets: 22 Headstock: Holly Veneer Binding: Slightly Darker Single-Ply Cream on Top and Neck Pickups: 2 Custom Wound Custom Buckers Controls: 2 Volume, 2 Tone; 3-way Toggleswitch with Thin Washer & Jackplate Hardware : Nickel Bridge: ABR-1 Tailpiece: Lightweight Aluminum Stopbar Tuners: Kluson "Deluxe" Case: Gibson Custom Hardshell COA: Yes
Title: 2014 Gibson Custom Shop Les Paul 1958 R8 Benchmark Series: Slow Iced Tea Fade
